conclusion: Induced current in the loop is calculated using emf E = B L v.
The current I = E / R = (B L v)/R, showing current is proportional to speed.
Power supplied by the external force is needed to maintain uniform motion.
Magnetic force magnitude is F = I L B.
Power delivered by the external force P = F v = (I L B) v.
Substituting I = B L v / R into power equation.
P = (B L v / R) (L B) v = (B² L² / R) v², showing power is proportional to v².
Final results: Ratio of loop currents I₁ : I₂ = 1 : 2 and Ratio of external powers P₁ : P₂ = 1 : 4.
